      • getCredentialsManager

        public CredentialsManager getCredentialsManager()
        Returns:
        CredentialsManager which is a wrapper around Storage+Encryptor

      • getApi

        Returns:
        Api client that you can use for advanced use cases

      • login

        public void login(@NonNull
                  android.content.Context context,
                  @NonNull
                  LoginRequest loginRequest,
                  @NonNull
                  AuthenticationCallback callback)
        Starts an async login session. If there are valid credentials in Storage they will be returned instead, preventing OIDC exchange. OIDC will open a browser custom tab(if supported) showing them your OIDC login/register page. After successful response credentials will be locally stored to skip the OIDC flow at next login.
        Parameters:
        context - activity/application context, library never stores context instances to prevent leaks
        loginRequest - object containing login options for OIDC
        callback - results of this call will be delivered through this object

      • logout

        public void logout(@NonNull
                   android.content.Context context,
                   @NonNull
                   LogoutRequest logoutRequest,
                   @NonNull
                   VoidCallback callback)
        Starts an async logout session. A browser custom tab will be launched momentarily for full sign out (local + sso) then the user will back to the app. If local storage does not have any id tokens and you don't provide one with the request an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        context - activity/application context, library never stores context instances to prevent leaks
        logoutRequest - object containing logout options for OIDC
        callback - results of this call will be delivered through this object
